intro: Geranium propinquum, commonly known as the common geranium, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring upright stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces clusters of small, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink, red, or white, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Geranium propinquum thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Its foliage and flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
